The jewel division in the south is the gate of blessings and virtues.
Therefore, the emissaries born are called the joy of wisdom.
Because the two adornments of blessings and wisdom are joy.
The lotus division in the west is the gate of wisdom.
Therefore, the emissaries that appear are called Anavatapta.
This means without heat.
It represents the lotus born in the water of the pond, pure and without defilements.
The karma division in the north is the gate of diligence.
Therefore, the emissaries born are called pointing to virtue.

Next, I will explain the method of making offerings.
If practitioners wish to make offerings,
They must first give rise to the bodhi mind.
What is the bodhi mind?
It means to give rise to the mind of saving sentient beings.
Contemplate the suffering and distress of sentient beings and give rise to the mind of rescuing and delivering them.
When giving rise to this mind in this way,
Acalanatha and the eight great youths will become uninvited teachers.
They will emerge from one's own mind to protect and uphold the practitioner.
One should make offerings to them.
Dwell in a secluded place in the mountains and forests.
Burn incense, scatter flowers, and recite the mantra.
When practicing in this way,
The messengers will appear in person and serve at one's will.
One must first pay homage to the Tathagatas of the four directions and make great vows.
Then, pay homage to the east and think like this:
Sentient beings are boundless, I vow to deliver them.
This is the vow of the great perfect mirror wisdom.
This is the gate of the mind of enlightenment.
The mind of enlightenment is the mind of delivering sentient beings.
Therefore, those who give rise to this vow and pay homage
Will always receive the empowerment of Vajrasattva until they attain Buddhahood.
It causes the mind of enlightenment to be fulfilled.
Next, pay homage to the south and think like this:
The boundless blessings and wisdom are vowed to be gathered.
This is the cause of the equality wisdom.
It is the gate of blessings and wisdom.
Because the two kinds of provisions of blessings and wisdom benefit sentient beings.
If one makes this vow and performs this prostration,
Up to the stage of Buddhahood, in each stage one will always obtain the empowerment conferred by Bodhisattva Akasagarbha.
Blessings and wisdom will be perfected.
Next, prostrate to the west and think like this:
The Dharma gates are boundless, I vow to study them all.
This is the cause of the wondrous observation wisdom.
It is the gate of wisdom.
Because one becomes the great Dharma King.
Those who make this vow and perform prostrations,
Up to the stage of Buddhahood, will obtain the empowerment of Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara.
Wisdom will be perfected.
Next, prostrate to the north and think like this:
The Tathagatas are boundless, I vow to serve them all.
This is the cause of the accomplishing wisdom.
It is the gate of activity.
Because one performs various activities in front of the Buddhas.
If one makes this vow and pays homage,
Until one attains Buddhahood, one will receive the empowerment of Vajrakarman Bodhisattva.
In all Buddha-lands, one will accomplish the practice of vast offerings.
Next, pay homage to Vairocana Tathagata and say this:
I vow to attain supreme enlightenment.
This is the cause of the wisdom of the essence of the Dharma realm.
Attain the stage of MahÄvairocana and Samantabhadra.
Pervade the Dharma realm.
In order to benefit sentient beings again, make this vow.
At that time, the Buddhas of the ten directions simultaneously certify it.
They praise, saying, Excellent!
Therefore, all the holy beings of the Bodhisattvas all protect it together.
Before long, one will attain the unsurpassed path.
The general vow has been spoken.
The other specific vows should be stated according to one's wishes.
Up to dedicating this wholesome root to equally benefiting oneself and others.
In addition, do not consume impure substances.
The mind is free from worry and does not give rise to afflictions such as greed, anger, and delusion.
Not delighting in worldly pleasures, deeply cultivating meditation.
Such a practitioner is the great joy of the world.
He is the teacher of sentient beings.
